softwareGame

Class Table

  • java.lang.Object
    • softwareGame.Table

  • public class Table
extends java.lang.Object
    CLASS TABLE
    Since:
    2016-03-26 (the version of the package this class was first added to)
    Version:
    1.0 (current version number of program)
    Author:
    Abelardo Valino , Andres Gonzalez

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Table()
      The constructor to be called by the user application when creating the table in which to play.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean canPlay(Domino d)
      Method that checks if a given Domino can be played in the Table.
      int getLeftValue()
      Method to obtain the left value of the table, which is one of the two possible values a Domino must have in order to be played.
      int getRightValue()
      Method to obtain the right value of the table, which is one of the two possible values a Domino must have in order to be played.
      void initialPlay(Domino d)
      Method to set the initial Domino in the table.
      void play(Domino d)
      Method that adds a given Domino to the table.
      java.lang.String printState()
      Method to obtain the String representation of table's state (left and right values).
      void setValue(Domino d)
      Method to set initial values to the right and left variables of the table.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Method to obtain the String representation of Dominos in the table.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Table

        public Table()
        The constructor to be called by the user application when creating the table in which to play.

    • Method Detail

      • getRightValue

        public int getRightValue()
        Method to obtain the right value of the table, which is one of the two possible values a Domino must have in order to be played.
        Returns:
        Right value of the table.

      • getLeftValue

        public int getLeftValue()
        Method to obtain the left value of the table, which is one of the two possible values a Domino must have in order to be played.
        Returns:
        Left value of the table.

      • setValue

        public void setValue(Domino d)
        Method to set initial values to the right and left variables of the table.
        Parameters:
        d - Domino that is going to be added to the table, which values are extracted so it will be an acceptable Domino.

      • canPlay

        public boolean canPlay(Domino d)
        Method that checks if a given Domino can be played in the Table. One of its values match with the left or the right value of the table.
        Parameters:
        d - Domino that is being verified to confirm it can be played.
        Returns:
        true if the Domino can be played, otherwise false.

      • initialPlay

        public void initialPlay(Domino d)
        Method to set the initial Domino in the table.
        Parameters:
        d - Domino to be setted in the table.

      • play

        public void play(Domino d)
        Method that adds a given Domino to the table. By default, the given Domino will be added in the left side of the table.
        Parameters:
        d - Domino to be added in the table.

      • printState

        public java.lang.String printState()
        Method to obtain the String representation of table's state (left and right values).
        Returns:
        String representation of the table's state.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Method to obtain the String representation of Dominos in the table.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String representation of the Dominos in the table.
